intro: Kirkbridea tetramera, commonly known as the four-lobed kirkbridea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its delicate, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a lobed or serrated margin. Kirkbridea tetramera is often grown in gardens for its ornamental value and prefers well-drained soil and full sun.
